articles.title: Deno 2.0 Release Candidate
articles.description: Deno started life as a manifestation of ideas that Node’s original creator, Ryan Dahl, had after his experiences with Node. Deno 2 is the next step: how the Deno team thinks Deno should ultimately be. Many changes await: window is gone and Node’s process appears, dependency management has been improved, numerous APIs have gone stable (e.g. WebGPU), and both Node.js API and CommonJS support have continued to improve.
articles.author: Bartek Iwańczuk and Andy Jiang

articles.title: Don't Sleep on AbortController
articles.description: AbortController is a broadly available mechanism for, originally, aborting Web requests on demand, but you can use it for a lot more than that (or ‘anything!’, as Artem explains).
articles.author: Artem Zakharchenko

articles.title: How Josh W. Comeau Rebuilt His Blog, App Router Style
articles.description: We’re huge fans of Josh’s blog and he’s just rebuilt it entirely using Next.js, MDX, Sandpack, and an array of other technologies. Here, he goes into great depth about what's involved. A good look behind the scenes of a modern React-driven project.
articles.author: Josh W Comeau

articles.title: A Guide to Destructuring in JavaScript
articles.description: The destructuring assignment syntax appeared in ES6 almost ten years ago and has become a central part of modern JavaScript development. This is a good primer/reminder of the potential.
articles.author: Mat Marquis

articles.title: The Nine Node Pillars: Principles for Doing Node Right
articles.description: A group of prolific and productive Node.js contributors have put together a checklist to identify gaps in your current Node development practices, particularly when building large-scale apps.
articles.author: Snell, Venditto, Dawson, Collina, et al.

articles.title: What Are Durable Functions? A Visual JavaScript Primer
articles.description: This is rather dependent on what Inngest, a durable function service, offers, but is a good primer to the general idea which may well suit your use cases.
articles.author: Lydia Hallie (Inngest)

articles.title: What's New in Express.js 5.0
articles.description: Express.js 5.0 landed recently with rather brief release notes, so here's a deeper look at what it has to offer. The updates are largely incremental, but set the stage for Express’s future.
articles.author: Trevor I. Lasn

articles.title: Angular Routing Essentials: Everything in One Post
articles.description: A bold claim, but it does a pretty good job.
articles.author: Oleksandr Kocherhin

articles.title: Using Reddit's JSON API from a JavaScript App
articles.description: How to pull data from Reddit’s API and display it in a simple web application built with Parcel.
articles.author: Muhammed Ali

articles.title: Schedule-X 2: A Modern Event Calendar Component
articles.description: Available in the form of React/Preact, Vue, Svelte, Angular, or plain JS components. Open source but with a premium version with extra features. GitHub repo.
articles.author: Tom Österlund

articles.title: 🧹 Vue Mess Detector: Code and Quality Analysis for Vue Projects
articles.description: A static analysis tool that can catch various bugs and code quality issues in Vue-based projects, built atop rules from the Vue.js Style Guide and others. GitHub repo.
articles.author: Various Contributors

articles.title: Tesseract.js: Pure JS OCR for 100+ Languages
articles.description: A port of the C++-based Tesseract library commonly used for extract text from images. The homepage has a live demo where you can drop your own images. GitHub repo.
articles.author: Tesseract Team

articles.title: HumanifyJS: Deobfuscate JavaScript Code using ChatGPT
articles.description: There’s an in-depth explainer here. The primary feature is its ability to reverse the loss of meaningful variable and function names based on the context of the code.
articles.author: Jesse Luoto

articles.title: React Snap Carousel: DOM-First, Headless Carousel
articles.description: Uses native browser scrolling and CSS scroll snap points for performance. Try out some of its features in its Storybook. The latest version adds support for infinite carousels.
articles.author: Richard Scarrott

articles.description: 🇪🇺 NodeConf EU is back. It takes place in Ireland this November 3-6.
🟨 It also appears JSConf is coming back under the care of the OpenJS Foundation.
📊 Minification Benchmarks is a frequently updated set of benchmarks for a suite of popular JavaScript minifiers.
🕹️ The most recent JS13kGames gamedev contest just ended. If you want to play the entries (or do some judging yourself) they're all here. I particularly liked The Way of the Dodo and Deep13.
Bun v1.1.29 – Its C compilation feature gets N-API support, but is otherwise largely a bugfix release.
Storybook 8.3 – A popular frontend component workshop is now using Vitest to rapidly speed up its component testing features.
Strapi 5 – Popular open source headless CMS.
Solid 1.9 – Declarative and performant reactivity for building UIs.
PostgreSQL 17 – The popular database isn't a JavaScript project, but a lot of you will be using it. Psst! We have a Postgres newsletter too!

articles.title: The First Public Working Draft of CSS Grid Level 3 / Masonry Layout
articles.description: This new draft represents progress on masonry layout as a built-in capability of CSS in two possible syntactic forms: a grid-integrated syntax, and a grid-independent syntax, both outlined as alternatives. The CSSWG has resolved to adopt fully mixed track sizing for this new layout model, allowing all the possible track listings expressible in CSS Grid for masonry layouts too.
articles.author: W3C

articles.title: ▶  CSS Masonry Layouts
articles.description: As we’ve covered in recent months (and as alluded to above) there’s differing, strong opinions on how best masonry layouts should finally be realised in CSS. Nicole does a good job of bringing us up to speed on the various sides both clearly and fairly.
articles.author: Nicole Sullivan

articles.title: How Josh W. Comeau Rebuilt His Blog, App Router Style
articles.description: We’re huge fans of Josh’s blog (particularly its wealth of CSS articles). He’s just rebuilt it entirely using Next.js, MDX, Sandpack, and an array of other technologies, and gives a detailed, behind the scenes look at a modern React-driven frontend project.
articles.author: Josh W Comeau

articles.title: Get Ready for Interop 2025: Your Chance to Shape the Web
articles.description: An invite to “help shape the future of web interoperability”. Submissions for ideas/proposals are being taken now, with the deadline on October 9th. Here’s what 2024 has focused on.
articles.author: Nicole Sullivan

articles.title: Improving Rendering Performance with CSS content-visibility
articles.description: When a page has 20,000 custom emoji on it, things may well get a touch slow. Nolan set out to fix things.
articles.author: Nolan Lawson

articles.title: A Redesign Case Study
articles.description: Like Josh Comeau (above), Ahmad Shadeed, whose excellent frontend articles we often feature, has too recently rebuilt his website, though with a stronger focus on the design. This case study digs into his rationale and process.
articles.author: Ahmad Shadeed

articles.title: The Frontend Treadmill
articles.description: Some candid advice and musings on the frontend ecosystem, technical decisions, and wasted energies: “our current framework layer is working against the grain instead of embracing the platform”.
articles.author: Marco Rogers

articles.title: Monitor Your Local and Real-User Core Web Vitals Performance in Chrome 129
articles.description: The latest Chrome features a completely redesigned Performance panel landing page featuring a live view of your local Core Web Vitals performance.
articles.author: Rick Viscomi

articles.title: How to Create a Chrome Extension with React, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS and Vite
articles.description: Covers everything you need to know right through to publishing in the Chrome Web Store.
articles.author: Lokman Musliu

articles.title: Clever Polypane Debugging Features I'm Loving
articles.description: A nice look at some of the handy features to be found in the stand-alone dev browser, Polypane.
articles.author: Ryan Trimble

articles.title: Dark Patterns Hall of Shame: Learn About Dark Patterns and Unethical Designs
articles.description: Real examples showcasing what not to do in UI design, with details/screenshots from real websites that have made such poor UI choices.
articles.author: Dark Patterns Hall of Shame

articles.title: CSS Almanac
articles.description: The almanac over at CSS Tricks has been spruced up. It’s a great resource packed with references for various CSS selectors and properties.
articles.author: Geoff Graham

articles.title: Vue-Multiselect 3.1: A Complete 'Selecting Solution' for Vue.js
articles.description: There’s a lot on offer here, complete with SSR support, Vuex support, strong test coverage, and with no dependencies.
articles.author: Damian Dulisz et al.

articles.title: Departure Mono: Monospace Pixel Font with a Lo-Fi Technical Vibe
articles.description: It’s open source and takes inspiration from “the constraints of early command-line and graphical user interfaces”, along with late 90s and early 2000s pixel fonts. Cool website!
articles.author: Tobias Fried

articles.title: blocks.md: Generate Forms and Web Pages from Markdown
articles.description: Not a free tool, but an interesting one to try out. It has its own syntax along the lines of something like Haml or Pug, and you can use it free locally.
articles.author: blocks.md
